body.p: Which of the following is the best description of the data used to generate this histogram? (Note that the horizontal axis has no scale, so you will make your choice based solely upon the histogram's shape.)

image.alt: histogram where all of the bars are aproximately the same

multiple_choice.choice: SAT Math scores of 1,000 future engineers and scientists
Results of rolling a six-sided die 1,000 times
Cholesterol levels of 1,000 adults
Shoe sizes of 1,000 men and women
Prices of 1,000 California homes

response.feedback: Incorrect. The bulk of the SAT Math scores of engineers and scientists would be high scores, since people interested in those fields are usually good at math. So that distribution would be skewed left.

Correct. This histogram's distribution is symmetric—uniform because all the bars are approximately the same height. Since rolling a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 is equally likely, we would expect the distribution to be symmetric—uniform.

Incorrect. We would expect the cholesterol levels of adults to consist of a few very low numbers and a few very high numbers, with most in the middle. So that distribution would be symmetric—unimodal.
Incorrect. The shoe sizes of women are usually smaller than those of men, so we would expect the data to bulk around two different shoe sizes. Thus, that distribution would be symmetric—bimodal.
Incorrect. We would expect a few mansions that are worth millions to make that distribution skewed right.

part.hint: Look at the histogram and decide which type of distribution it is. Then find a dataset that would match that distribution.
Since the bars in this histogram are all roughly the same height, this distribution is symmetric—uniform.

body.p: Which of the following is the best description of the data used to generate this histogram? (Note that the horizontal axis has no scale, so you will make your choice based solely upon the histogram's shape.)

multiple_choice.choice: SAT Math scores of 1,000 future engineers and scientists
Results of rolling a six-sided die 1,000 times
Cholesterol levels of 1,000 adults
Shoe sizes of 1,000 men and women
Prices of 1,000 California homes

response.feedback: Incorrect. The bulk of the SAT Math scores of engineers and scientists would be high scores, since people interested in those fields are usually good at math. So that distribution would be skewed left.
Incorrect. The rolls of a die have a symmetric—uniform distribution, since rolling a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 is equally likely.

Correct. This histogram's distribution is symmetric—unimodal—the highest bars are in the middle, with the rest sloping symmetrically down on both sides. We would expect the cholesterol levels of adults to consist of a few very low numbers and a few very high numbers, with most in the middle.
Incorrect. The shoe sizes of women are usually smaller than those of men, so we would expect the data to bulk around two different shoe sizes. Thus, that distribution would be symmetric—bimodal.
Incorrect. We would expect a few mansions that are worth millions to make that distribution skewed right.

part.hint: Look at the histogram and decide which type of distribution it is. Then find a dataset that would match that distribution.
Note that the highest bars in this histogram are in the center.

body.p: Which of the following is the best description of the data used to generate this histogram? (Note that the horizontal axis has no scale, so you will make your choice based solely upon the histogram's shape.)

multiple_choice.choice: SAT Math scores of 1,000 future engineers and scientists
Results of rolling a six-sided die 1,000 times
Cholesterol levels of 1,000 adults
Shoe sizes of 1,000 men and women
Prices of 1,000 California homes

response.feedback: Incorrect. The bulk of the SAT Math scores for engineers and scientists would be high scores, since people interested in those fields are usually good at math. So that distribution would be skewed left.
Incorrect. The rolls of a die have a symmetric—uniform distribution, since rolling a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 is equally likely.

Incorrect. We would expect the cholesterol levels of adults to consist of a few very low numbers and a few very high numbers, with most in the middle. So that distribution would be symmetric—unimodal.

Correct. The histogram's distribution is symmetric—bimodal, since there are two peaks. Since the shoe sizes of women are usually smaller that those of men, we would expect two places where the bars are higher.
Incorrect. We would expect a few mansions that are worth millions to make that distribution skewed right.

part.hint: Look at the histogram and decide which type of distribution it is. Then find a description that matches that distribution.
Note that this histogram has two places where the bars are higher.

body.p: Which of the following is the best description of the data used to generate this histogram? (Note that the horizontal axis has no scale, so you will make your choice based solely upon the histogram's shape.)

multiple_choice.choice: SAT Math scores of 1,000 future engineers and scientists
Results of rolling a six-sided die 1,000 times
Cholesterol levels of 1,000 adults
Shoe sizes of 1,000 men and women
Prices of 1,000 California homes

response.feedback: Incorrect. The bulk of the SAT Math scores for engineers and scientists would be high scores, since people interested in those fields are usually good at math. So that distribution would be skewed left.
Incorrect. The rolls of a die have a symmetric—uniform distribution, since rolling a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 is equally likely.

Incorrect. We would expect the cholesterol levels of adults to consist of a few very low numbers and a few very high numbers, with most in the middle. So that distribution would be symmetric—unimodal.
Incorrect. The shoe sizes of women are usually smaller than those of men. So we would expect the data to bulk around two different shoe sizes. Thus, that distribution would be symmetric—bimodal.
Correct. This histogram has the bulk of the data on the left, and thus is skewed right. We would expect a few mansions that are worth millions to make this distribution skewed right.

part.hint: Look at the histogram and decide which type of distribution it is. Then find a description that matches that distribution.
Note that in this histogram the highest bars are on the left, with a long right tail, and possible outliers on the right.

Incorrect. The shoe sizes of women are usually smaller than those of men. So we would expect the data to bulk around two different shoe sizes. Thus, that distribution would be symmetric—bimodal.
